member.name: F:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.totalTime
member.summary: This class makes the appropriate arrangements for the solution of linear dynamic equations according to implicit Newmark method Authors: George Stavroulakis, George Soimiris
Creates an instance that uses a specific problem type and an appropriate child analyzer for the construction of the system of equations arising from the actual physical problem
member.param: Instance of the model to be solved
Instance of the solver that will handle the solution of the system of equations
Instance of the problem type to be solver
Instance of the child analyzer that will handle the solution of the system of equations
Instance of the time step of the method that will be initialized
Instance of the total time of the method that will be initialized
Instance of parameter "alpha" of the method that will be initialized
Instance of parameter "delta" of the method that will be initialized

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.BuildMatrices
member.summary: Makes the proper solver-specific initializations before the solution of the linear system of equations. This method MUST be called before the actual solution of the aforementioned system

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.GetOtherRhsComponents(MGroup.MSolve.Solution.LinearSystem.IGlobalVector)
member.summary: Calculates inertia forces and damping forces.

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.Initialize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the models, the solvers, child analyzers, builds the matrices, assigns loads and initializes right-hand-side vectors.

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.Solve
member.summary: Solves the linear system of equations by calling the corresponding method of the specific solver attached during construction of the current instance

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.CalculateRhsImplicit
member.summary: Calculates the right-hand-side of the implicit dyanmic method. This will be used for the solution of the linear dynamic system.

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.Builder.SetNewmarkParameters(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.param: Used in the intepolation between the accelerations of the previous and current time step, in order to obtain the current displacements. Also called alpha by Bathe.
Used in the intepolation between the accelerations of the previous and current time step, in order to obtain the current velocities. Also called delta by Bathe.
If set to true, the user must make sure that the time step chosen is lower than the critical step size corresponding to these particular , parameters.

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.Builder.SetNewmarkParametersForCentralDifferences
member.summary: Central diffences: gamma = 1/2, beta = 0. Newmark results in central diffences, a conditionally stable explicit method. To ensure stability, the time step must be <= the critical step size = 2 / w, where w is the maximum natural radian frequency. It would be more efficient to use an explicit dynamic analyzer.

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.Builder.SetNewmarkParametersForConstantAcceleration
member.summary: Constant acceleration (also called average acceleration or trapezoid rule): gamma = 1/2, beta = 1/4. This is the most common scheme and is unconditionally stable. In this analyzer, it is used as the default.

member.name: M:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Dynamic.NewmarkDynamicAnalyzer.Builder.SetNewmarkParametersForLinearAcceleration
member.summary: Linear acceleration: gamma = 1/2, beta = 1/6. This is more accurate than the default constant acceleration, but it conditionally stable. To ensure stability, the time step must be <= the critical step size = 3.464 / w = 0.551 * T, where w is the maximum natural radian frequency and T is the minimum natural period.

member.summary: This does not work if the requested node belongs to an element that contains embedded elements.

member.name: F:MGroup.NumericalAnalyzers.Logging.TotalLoadsDisplacementsPerIncrementLog.currentTotalDisplacement
member.summary: In case of displacement control, where there is a prescribed displacement at the monitored dof, we can only access the applied displacement which is scaled to 1/loadSteps at the beginning and remains constant during the iterations. Therefore we need to keep track of the previous displacements. This only happens for constrained dofs. For free dofs this field is not used.

member.summary: This also writes to the output file.
